com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer

Class SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.concurrent.circularbuffer.SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element stored in the underlying circular buffer
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SingleConsumerSelfMovableCircularBufferQueue

    public class SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue<T>
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Simple utility queue implementation that wraps a CircularBuffer and supports multiple producers and one consumer.
    Instances of this class have a simple lifecycle:
    • Upon creation, a circular buffer is created and a consumer thread is started immediately.
    • Method put(T) is used to place new elements into the buffer.
    • Elements are consumed by the SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue.Consumer instance provided upon construction.
    • Method waitTillEmpty(int, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit) can be used to wait for the buffer to become empty in a blocking manner.
    • When method close() is invoked, the buffer consumer thread is shutdown.
    This implementation supports two consumer thread barriers: blocking and spinning.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue.Consumer<U>
      An instance of this interface is used to consume elements off the queue.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue

        public SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue(String name,
                                         int size,
                                         boolean blocking,
                                         SingleConsumerCircularBufferQueue.Consumer<T> consumer,
                                         ElementFactory<T> factory,
                                         Movable<T,T,Future<T>> movable,
                                         NamedTaskExecutorService executor,
                                         int closeTimeoutInMillis)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - the queue's name. Used only for logging purposes. Cannot be null or empty.
        size - the minimum capacity of the underlying CircularBuffer. The actual capacity will be this value rounded up to the next power of two. Must be strictly positive.
        blocking - controls the type of thread barrier used by the CircularBuffer's consumer: if true, a blocking barrier is used, if false, a spinning barrier is used.
        consumer - the consumer of elements placed into this queue. Cannot be null.
        factory - the factory for creating new entries in the underlying CircularBuffer. Cannot be null.
        movable - used to copy state across between an object being put into this queue and an element of the underlying CircularBuffer. Cannot be null.
        executor - used to execute the CircularBuffer's consumer thread. Cannot be null.
        closeTimeoutInMillis - the number of milliseconds before method close() times out. Must be strictly positive.

      • waitTillEmpty

        public void waitTillEmpty(int timeout,
                          TimeUnit unit)
                   throws TimeoutException
        Blocks until the queue becomes empty, or times out if the queue is still not empty after the given amount of time.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the amount of time before this operation times out. Must be strictly positive
        unit - the unit in which the timeout is expressed. Cannot be null.
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if the queue is still not empty after the given amount of time
